describe torque?
option_1: is the vector product of force and lever arm length.
option_2: is a scalar and has no direction associated with it

question:
In which of the following cases the net
force is not zero?
option_1: A kite skillfully held stationary in the sky
option_2: A ball freely falling from a height
option_3: An aeroplane rising upwards at an angle of \( 45^{\circ} \) with the horizontal with a constant speed
option_4: A cork floating on the surface of water
Subject: Physics
correct_answer: A kite skillfully held stationary in the sky

question:

the hinges. The time \( T \) needed for the doors to close is given by:
\( \left[\text {Given}: \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \frac{\boldsymbol{d} \boldsymbol{\theta}}{\sqrt{\sin \theta}}=\boldsymbol{N}\right] \) (Consider
the door as a square plate)
A \( \cdot \mathrm{T}=(\sqrt{\frac{3 \mathrm{d}}{2 \mathrm{a}}}) \mathrm{N} \)
option_1:
The acceleration a is constant and the
centre of mass is at a distance d from
the hinges. The time \( T \) needed for the doors to close is given by:
\( \left[\text {Given}: \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \frac{\boldsymbol{d} \boldsymbol{\theta}}{\sqrt{\sin \theta}}=\boldsymbol{N}\right] \) (Consider
the door as a square plate)
A \( \cdot \mathrm{T}=(\sqrt{\frac{3 \mathrm{d}}{2 \mathrm{a}}}) \mathrm{N} \)
Subject: Physics
correct_answer:
The acceleration a is constant and the
centre of mass is at a distance d from
the hinges. The time \( T \) needed for the doors to close is given by:
\( \left[\text {Given}: \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \frac{\boldsymbol{d} \boldsymbol{\theta}}{\sqrt{\sin \theta}}=\boldsymbol{N}\right] \) (Consider
the door as a square plate)
A \( \cdot \mathrm{T}=(\sqrt{\frac{3 \mathrm{d}}{2 \mathrm{a}}}) \mathrm{N} \)

question:
When a sphere rolls down an inclined plane, then identify the correct statement related to the work done by
friction force
option_1: The friction force does positive translational work
option_2: The friction force does negative rotational work
option_3: The net work done by friction is zero
Subject: Physics
correct_answer: The friction force does positive translational work

Speed cannot change linearly with time.

correct_answer: Both Assertion and Reason are correct and Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion
